website_summaries.verdict: The best on the market. Midway has thought of everything when designing this model. We especially love the the fact that it folds easily for added convenience.
pros: A rugged, well-built dog crate that comes with a 1-year warranty
This established brand stands out for its tool-free set up, easy folding feature, and Electro-coat finish

customer_reviews.title: Doors could be improved
customer_reviews.text: This crate is fairly straightforward to assemble, and the divider panel is really essential for crate training a puppy. The only major downside of the crate for me is that neither door opens and lays flat against the sides of the crate. This is most noticable and annoying with the side door, which also opens out to the left (into open air) as opposed to the right (flat against the crate), which requires more space. The crate design could be improved if either the doors opened vertically or layed flat against the sides of the crate.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Jordan

customer_reviews.title: 42" big enough for 100lb lab mix
customer_reviews.text: My 100 lb Lab mix loves it. It is plenty big enough for him to lay in it with the door closed. Whenever he feels like he is in trouble, scared, or hot (he likes to lay on the cool plastic. The divider was useful when he was a pup for restricting how much room he had while training. It will collapse to about 4 inches tall. Double door cage has one door on end and 2nd door on side. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and very shady “customer support”
customer_reviews.text: I originally posted a negative review in 2016. Recently I was contacted by a representative of the company selling the cage. They asked I remove the negative review in exchange for $30 compensation. They were very nice and seemed to try and “make up for my poor experience.” As you guessed and what I thought might happen, I deleted the review and didn’t receive a cent. I want all individuals looking at this cage to know it was not built of study steel at all and the door could be pushed open by my small dog. Over all very poor quality and would deform when collapsed for transport. Even with care it was unusable within a month. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: SomeRandomGuy

customer_reviews.title: Best dog crate for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our lab who is around 70 lbs at 5 months and he fits perfect with some room to grow. I bought the same size crate for our other lab at petco for $50 more and it's made so much cheaper! This one would definitely hold a dog trying to escape in! It's very sturdy and built great!
customer_reviews.author: Elisha Roesel

customer_reviews.title: Beware - Dog Death with this crate
customer_reviews.text: I am writing to tell you about a tragic event that happened to my new puppy. We left him in your crate for several hours and due to the poor sizing of your mesh, he jumped up on the crate and tried to bite into the mesh bar by twisting his head to the side to get between the bars. He ended up caught and strangled himself. I am very concerned about your product on the open market. My dog was a Sussex Spaniel and was not that small at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Somberg

customer_reviews.title: Please do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: I had to return two of these and they were both broken out of the box. The first replacement and a broken hinge and the second one had another broken hinge, was misshapen and bent and had the roller wheels missing. It really sucks because it is very difficult to send these back through the mail. My recommendation would be to NOT buy large items through amazon because they are extra hard to replace and this is not a high quality kennel
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Land

customer_reviews.title: Excellent crate, easy to assemble. Goes great with a Dogbed4less Orthopedic memory gel bed (link in comments)
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and the perfect size for my 35-pound Australian Cattle Dog mix. IF you want to make this your dog's den for sleeping at night, consider purchasing a Midwest Life crate cover, which covers the back, sides, and top of the crate. It removes easily. For comfort at the bottom of the crate, consider buying a Dogbed4less Orthodpedic memory gel bed that almost perfectly fits the bottom of this crate. It's water proof and comes with two washable microfiber-type covers, one brown, one grey. I'm not a pitchman for Midwest Life Stages or Dogbed4less. I've owned dogs for almost forty years and this is perhaps the best crate/bed setup I've had.
customer_reviews.author: I only review products I bought

customer_reviews.title: I initially wrote a horrible review for this product as my puppy climbed up ...
customer_reviews.text: I initially wrote a horrible review for this product as my puppy climbed up the side of this crate and got his head stuck in one of the top openings. I just realized that I had the crate UPSIDE DOWN! I feel horrible that I endangered my puppy by being so stupid. I did not read the little blue tag on the front or I would have realized that the words were upside down (it was on the front at the bottom after I set it up and I just didn't bend down to read it). This is a good crate...just don't be stupid like me and set it upside down.
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this crate 2 times. Both times the crate came with the tray broken and it was not a delivery issue. I tried contacting the company, but they don't answer the phone and they never returned my call. The metal construction seemed solid, but the second crate we received it was not put together completely and it was too difficult to manipulate the construction ourselves. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good crate for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good dog crate. It is as good as the ones at pet stores that cost $20-50 more for the same thing. I got the 36 inch. It is strong. The only problems with it are that is is heavier than you might expect and therefore somewhat difficult to move. Folding it up is not always convenient, so the weight makes it awkward to carry, but it also makes it strong. The other problem is that it has rubber feet on it to protect the floor. These will not stay on. I recommend sitting it on a rug or carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: My Great Pyrenees/lab mix 1yr old puppy outgrew the smaller size. I received her new crate today and it is perfect. I don't thing she will outgrow this one. She has plenty of room to turn around and lay down. It arrived in perfect condition and very easy to assemble. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: athena007

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done but not seamless by any stretch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews. I have only had adult rescue dogs and this is my first puppy, ergo this crate. One of the locks/latches came right off before I even tried to use it. The middle divider gate really only divides the thing down the middle. The whole thing is way too pliable for a steel apparatus. It literally relies on being able to shove it into place, which just give me little confidence in its ability to hold up. Its been the most stressful part of having a new puppy--which says a lot! The puppy is a dream...
customer_reviews.author: IndyInTheCity

customer_reviews.title: Poor design!
customer_reviews.text: There are rough spots on the wire end edge at the doorways which will tear the skin on your arm and I’m sure it would do the same for your pet. All those spots need to be rounded off to prevent further injury. There is also a big gap between the closed front door and the frame. It was easy for my puppy to get her paw lodged in between that space. You could buy a bigger/ thicker dog bed but then the divider won’t work. Save your money and buy a higher quality/better built crate.
customer_reviews.author: Powerhouse Pete

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This kennel is sturdier that most I've used. The metal seems to be a heavier gauge which is nice for larger dogs. It comes with a divider to use to narrow down the space for potty training if desired. This is also a little taller than most the size large kennels. If you have a dog that is a little taller in a sitting position this really makes a difference to make sure they can sit comfortably. It's heavier in weight than some of the other large wire kennels. Comes with handles and having the two door (side & end) options is nice. Allows more flexibility on where you locate it and your dogs ability to access. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: JCM

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere; quality has really faded.
customer_reviews.text: Frankly not durable. At all. The first night my lab broke the door off (first picture). After we secured it, she ate the floor of the crate (damage was done in one hour- second photo). We bought one of these quite a while ago and it worked well, but after our dog passed away we donated it. Got a new dog and bought the same crate. Should have been a slam dunk. But something happened to the quality and just whoa. Not impressive any longer (for comparison, we had the other one for several years, same size purchased, with two dogs that were much more destructive than our current dog and barely a dent).
customer_reviews.author: Marrisa B.

customer_reviews.title: Bought again because we liked it!
customer_reviews.text: We got this crate for our first dog 6 years ago and have grown to like it. Our only problem is that the bottom rusts and gets on our carpet, so we have to put towels underneath the kennel. We got a new puppy and for that reason bought a different kennel. Had to return because we like the layout of this kennel much better, so we bought this kennel again. Still have to put towels on bottom. Wish that it wouldn’t rust on bottom, but still love the kennel and how easy it is to open the door. Pros: -easy to open -large space Cons: -rust on bottom
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Dude, I should have looked at the dimensions and not the picture!! I bought this crate after my 60lb. pit mix chewed up one too many of my things. The photo shows a German Shepherd looking what I think is a little cramped, so I thought it would be perfect for my dog. I can easily fit three of him in this crate!! Seriously, it you don't own a Great Dane or a Mastiff, you don't need an XL crate. That being said, my dog likes the crate (he often goes in there even when I don't ask him to), and it is well made, and I think a good value. I highly recommend this crate, but check the dimensions!!
customer_reviews.author: Antoine

customer_reviews.title: Floor pan cracked within first week of use.
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a shoddy product. The cage itself is ok, but the plastic floor pan cracked within the first week of use and is now breaking into pieces from nothing more than the dog entering and exiting the cage. It is a very thin, brittle material that can't take any weight on it. Our dog is a puppy, having gone from about 30 to 45 pounds and the floor pan is now in pieces. They could come up with a plastic pan that would not break but obviously have chosen not to to reduce cost.
customer_reviews.author: NC Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my black lab puppy back in April. We crate her at night or during these hot Texas summer days, as she forgets she's not the size of our Yorkie. I hate this cage now. Two months...inside...and the front door won't even shut now because it's suddenly warped. She doesn't bite at or pull the bars, so we can't figure out why it's not latching anymore. There's an extra safety feature that has you slightly life the door over the bars before you slide the latches closed. We can't even get these to latch or get the slides closed. I would NOT recommend this cage to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: JPH

customer_reviews.title: Great crate but beware of puppies chewing the bRS
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we loved this crate for our 9 week old german shepherd. Its easy to assemble and move around. She was really loving it too and we had the divider in as well. However we had a little traumatic experience with it last night, our puppy got her jaws stuck and locked in while chewing a front bar. She screamed so loudly and it panicked us a greta deal we thought she was going to snap her neck, we luckily were able to get her bottom jaw free, and we had no idea that crates had this risk. So just be careful with teething puppies!
customer_reviews.author: Bik

customer_reviews.title: Great crate!
customer_reviews.text: I research most of my purchases like a crazy person. After looking at cages for my new girl, I chose this one. I am very happy. My dog has separation anxiety (not sure of her background since she was a rescue) but this cage offers plenty of room for her and it's very secure. I don't worry that she is going to pull a Houdini on me and work her way out of it. She weighs about 30 lbs. and is very comfortable in there. The tray pulls out if you need to clean and there are 2 latches for extra security. This was a great purchase and the price was good too.
customer_reviews.author: cathy oakley

customer_reviews.title: Easy Breezy
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect as far as the size of the crate. It is truly XL both of my dogs fit comfortably in it at the same time! One weighs 105 and is an American Bull Dog/ Boxer Mix and the other weighs 85 she's mixed breed as well the shelter where we rescued her had her listed as a Mastiff mix! The assemble was easy no directions were needed, I just pulled it out of the shipping box and assembled it. It comes in one piece it's just folded. It's pretty sturdy as well. I recommend it for large dogs because it really is XL!
customer_reviews.author: L. Nash

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: We originally planned to return two crates because of latch problems. Amazon and seller promptly shipped replacements. We have decided to keep the original two crates even though there is a minor problem with latch alignment because the crates are very high quality and we can work around the alignment problem. We are also going to keep the replacements because we appreciate Amazon and the seller and can use these crates eventually. The crates are extremely well made and our Pomeranians are very happy with them. So are we.
customer_reviews.author: Jack B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: We bought a puppy that will eventually outgrow it, for now it is great and I am using the dividing gate so I don't leave it so large that he might urinate in it. Only took a minute or two to assemble and I look forward to him growing big enough to remove the divider and then to put up my extra large crate. He's a Greater Swiss Mountain Dog so he will outgrow it:-)
customer_reviews.author: Linam g

customer_reviews.title: The quality definitely varies
customer_reviews.text: We got 3 of these to start crate feeding our cats. Two assembled fairly easily. The first was pretty easy and nothing took much pressure to stick. It also meant it was less rigid so I wouldn't trust picking it up and moving it with one hand. The second took a bit more pressure but feels sturdy. The third took two of us, lots of grunting and some pliers. We will never fold that one back down. So far, they've stayed in the same spot we set them up and have been serving their function since.
customer_reviews.author: Lainna

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12 yr old dog who recently started going potty when ever and where ever she wants. Only solution, get a kennel. I was pleasantly surprised how good this one is. Very easy to set up. My dog and cats sleep in it. Recently went to visit my son out of state, was relieved on how easy this was to transport. The only thing I did was when folded up, I used heavy duty velcro straps to secure it closed. I didn't feel confident with the clips that come attached, so I removed them as they get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: TLL

customer_reviews.title: Glad Amazon had these
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my crazy 11 month old German Shepherd. He outgrew the the large size that I had for my Golden Retriever. He likes to chew things when you turn your back on him. He is getting better but I will continue to use it when I leave the house and at night until he becomes completely trustworthy. It is strong and well made and I am very happy I bought it. Definitely worth the price. He would chew up a lot more than this crate cost. Crates also make housebreaking much easier. I feed him in it and and he runs into it when he knows I am preparing his food.
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Purrrfect!
customer_reviews.text: This cage is fantastic! We initially purchased a cage from another manufacturer. It had a steel pan which would likely rust over time. More importantly the other cage was wobbly and did not fit together as firmly. The Life Stages cage is very sturdy and has more substantial door latches. We used the divider a bit differently than intended. We installed it sideways in the cage, covered it with a piece of cardboard and a towel, and made a loft for the kitten. He is able to climb the side of the cage to reach the loft. This use of the divider essentially doubles the useable area of the cage for small, climbing pets.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: I love these kennels!!!
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE BELOW*** Okay we have had this thing for several months. We live on a semi truck and only use it when we go into the mechanic shop. We left it folded up and on one of our tires and ran it over. It is just fine. I can’t see any damanage. These kennels are honestly the best. Fast shipping, you can put it together in 5 minutes tops and it lasts forever!!! Unfortunately we got it for a naughty kitty who likes to ruin blinds and dig in the plants at night. He honestly doesn’t mind being in the kennel, so win win! I was in no way paid or reimbursed for my honest review.
customer_reviews.author: The Fox

customer_reviews.title: I modified it for training; good value..
customer_reviews.text: Got this to train an INSANE dog that we had to watch for a month...it looks like a monkey-squirrel-teddy bear mutant creature and makes the same noise barking as a normal dog does when you step on its tail. I cut a few of the "bars" out of the partition so the "thing" would have a small sleeping compartment and an opening to a larger area to..."do its business" in. At least it's a smart animal and is now quiet...until my GF gets home, at least. It then begins its shrieking..
customer_reviews.author: gmsky

customer_reviews.title: DIY potty training kennel!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong kennel, works great. I removed the door on the small kennel I bought, and the door on the end of the medium 2 door kennel I also bought and wired the two open doorways together so that the area of the small kennel Could be a potty area and the medium kennel was my yorkies sleeping area. It saved me a ton of money to rig up my own kennel/potty training kennel than buying a popular potty training kennel (+ a potty training video) that was listed for $600. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: fixthepain

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable option
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it was to fold this and put this away. The item has some weight to it, but not too much. The crate also has 2 door ways so if you are training a small dog this can help with that aspect. I did not like the floor as I felt that it was a little flimsy and too easy to bend, which when storing could be an issue. Overall I am satisfied with the product though it is worth noting that his crate is basically POP UP style as all the metal pieces stay together and fold in.
customer_reviews.author: martok

customer_reviews.title: BIG kennel
customer_reviews.text: When I received this, it was stuck together pretty tightly. I'm sure it was from being shipped. I worked it loose and it went together easily. IF YOU''RE NOT USED TO LIFTING HEAVY THINGS I HIGHLY RECOMMEND GETTING HELP TO BRING IT INSIDE........it is very heavy. It's n excellent kennel for large breeds. Easy to clean and sturdy enough to keep your dog safe and secure. Be sure and remove dog's collar before putting him or her in, better safe than sorry. All in all a good buy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: windward

customer_reviews.title: No happy but taken care of with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of These cages & I was very disappointed, they broke with in 6 months or less & My golden retrievers where only 4 to 8 months old & they love being in there crate at night but for some reason these ICRATE'S broke very quickly. I called Midwest & they upgraded my crates at a cost to me after they saw the picture. I am happy with Midwest's customer service but very unhappy with the crates. My new crates are much stronger so I would recommend if you have questions about the gauge of wire used you call Midwest first.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to set up. Haven't been able to put divider panel in because it isn't wide enough to hook on the sides so going to see if my husband can work on it. Also wish they would make it with a pass through so my Boston can sleep on one end and potty on the other,but I did know this when I ordered it. Tray comes out easy for clean up so there is nothing to take apart. I will be using this for the life of my dog. I would buy again. They just need to make the divider panel a little wider to hook to the side walls of the crate.
customer_reviews.author: CSO54

customer_reviews.title: Best crate out there
customer_reviews.text: I've use Midwest crates for the last 25 years. Unfortunately these crates are not as well constructed as the ones of 25 years ago but then again what is. These crates are sturdy and will hold very strong athletic dogs like my German Shepherds and Newfoundlands. I always get the biggest one possible and use the divider for potty training. Because this is their portable home they need to have a lot of room. As I stated in the title this is the best crate out there.
customer_reviews.author: Lonewolf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 80# lab
customer_reviews.text: This kennel is perfect. It's high quality and easy to fold up. We use this kennel daily for 80# lab who fits in this great. He can sit in it without crouching and this will last a good 10 years. The double door is great for different situations like having it along side a bed or access it from multiple side in the living room. I also like the double latch because he cannot fit his paw in the bottom or top corner like some less quality kennels. A must-have for training a new dog.
customer_reviews.author: Leap Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed to find out they hadn't
customer_reviews.text: After reading the prior purchaser's reviews, and in spite of the critiques about the crate's sharp edges, I ordered the crate thinking the manufacturer had improved the product. I was disappointed to find out they hadn't. Our crate was delivered with quite a few sharp edges which my husband had to file down so our newly adopted dog would be safe. Wish I could give a better review. Maybe Midwest will read and heed their customers' reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New crate.
customer_reviews.text: Reinforced corners and top to side connections with zip ties as hot as sturdy as out previous crate that outlived it's useful life. All the new ones are shorter but wider than our previous brand, and will take some time to get used to it. Otherwise seems fine dog got in with no problems. I also prefer the single center latch on old one vs the double latches on new ones, the lower latch just too far down for our liking but it's ok since we don't have an escape artist, he enjoys going in.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Next time I would look for a well built crate with a metal tray.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this crate for a 7 month old lab/boxer mix dog. The dog was crated for 2 1/2 hours. Upon arriving home, we found the dog had destroyed the plastic tray. The metal crate itself has very thick wire. Very strong! It’s not like some flimsy cages that the wire can bend easily. We had to find a steel pan to replace the plastic tray. All crates should have steel trays. We had to fish out $70 for a steel tray!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hammel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kennel for mastiff puppy!
customer_reviews.text: This kennel is perfect for our mastiff puppy! It seemed so large when we first got her but she quickly grew into it! She is a 1 year old now and we don't use it any longer but kept it in case we need it for travel or anything like that. She can still walk in it, turn around, and lay down. It is super easy to set up and use and worked really great for potty training and sleeping at night. Would definitely purchase another one like this again!
customer_reviews.author: Becka

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT IS DANGEROUS & should be recalled.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you want your arm or hand ripped open DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT. I reached into the crate to get my 8 week old puppy & the edge of the door did this. I felt around the opening & there were other very sharp edges as well. At least mu puppy wasn’t damaged or it would not want to use a crate again
customer_reviews.author: L. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We got this crate for our Australian Shepherd pup, hoping it would suit him his whole life from when we got him (8 weeks), until he matures at around 55 lbs or so. We probably could have gotten the medium, but I wanted to err on being a little bigger, and he has loved it from Day 1. At the end of each day we put him on our bed to snuggle and play for a bit (he's 12 weeks now), but when he's done he always whines and looks at his crate, waiting to be put back in it.
customer_reviews.author: APG

customer_reviews.title: Standard and great
customer_reviews.text: Mostly easy to assemble. Putting it up was easy with a quick glance at the directions. The divider is a bit hard to maneuver, but with some patience it works great. I love that the crate will grow with my puppy! You’ll want some blankets to make it a little more comfortable for your dog as the bottom of the crate is solid and hard. The locks on the door work well. The metal has withstood a bit of puppy gnawing with no marks. I’m sure a dog with real teeth could do more damage to the paint on the metal, but so far I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kaley Martin

customer_reviews.title: had to return but ordered new one
customer_reviews.text: Opened one end of box and a corner section dropped out - was broken and jagged. In the return process I asked if the shipper could pick it up as the entire crate was very heavy and I have an injured knee. Amazon indicated I had to take the crate to a UPS store for return. I managed to return it to a UPS store. Did order another crate - same model and it arrived with no damage. I'm using it for my 60 pound English Shepherd and it works great
customer_reviews.author: ES owner

customer_reviews.title: Big Fan of MidWest Kennels!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of 4 MidWest Kennels we have; we have a 24”, 30”, 36”, and a 42” and they are all awesome! I love that I can fold them up for storage and, after using plastic dog crates for years, I love the open ventilation of the wire kennels! Nice and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Daytona675

customer_reviews.title: Highest Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Midwest Crate in 20 years. I recently downsized from the 24 inch to 22 inch. There were NO sharp edges, I assembled it in less than 5 minutes, and the quality is the same as 20 years ago. Very good. Midwest makes the best dog/pet crates. I leave the door open and the dogs can go into the crate just to hang out by themselves or if I need to crate them for a very short period of time, then I close the door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this crate AND we love this crate
customer_reviews.text: We waited many years to finally purchase a crate for our dog. She was making messes in the house and we had no other options left. She loves the crate and WE love the crate. It has changed our lives. The crate is very sturdy, and plenty of room for her and her soft bed. We also purchased metal dishes to attach to the side bars. They are great, as well. Always know where her dishes are, and not stepping in them and leaving water on the floor. Good stuff. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Simple design and very durable
customer_reviews.text: I loved how easy this crate was to set up! Once out of the box, you pull both of the sides up, pull the back up, and then the front and you're good to go!! No trying to fit pieces together or clamp or clasp or screw things together. I don't foresee cleaning the sides and front/back to be super easy(no crate of this size would be)--the bottom tray is easy to clean--but to wash the whole thing, you'd almost have to drag the whole thing outside and hose it down if it ever got really nasty.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Quality matches price
customer_reviews.text: I like this crate but the door is warped so it doesn't close flush and the lock doesn't seem as if it will hold if my dog gets aggressive with it. I have a chihuahua and he rattles the door to where it looks as if it may open. I'm going to have to put something else on the door to hold it shut. Also the hooks for the plastic tray bottom are positioned too high and can't be used. So they just flop out front oddly.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cats
customer_reviews.text: I use this to feed my cats in. They took to it pretty quickly. The divider doesn't stay put, which is the only complaint I have (I use duct tape to hold it still. The shirt is to block their view of each others' food.). This way the food bully doesn't eat his sister's food and I don't have to babysit them every meal. They cry and refuse to eat if they are put into separate rooms for meals, so this is a real winner for me. I found that the 30 in w/ divider double door is perfect for feeding two average sized cats (9lbs and 12lbs).
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: That one should always read the directions first.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the crate. It is big enough for my Rascal to have room for his bed, food and water dishes, also some toys. It is his safe happy place. The only time he is closed in it is when we have to go somewhere for a little while. Before when we left, he ran amok gathering up everything he could tear up, chew up or apart. He tore up and took outside glass decorative grapes, broke china table decor, chewed up books, and took outside; nightgowns , adult shoes and house slippers, pillows, throws, blankets, and his stuffed animals all through the doggie door to the backyard. In all kinds of weather.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene McNealy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive high quality kennel
customer_reviews.text: Just received this kennel. I purchased a smaller 24” kennel in a store. It was $6 cheaper than this 30” kennel and the quality of the store kennel didn’t come close to this kennel. It’s sturdy, well made, easy to assemble, and has a solid tray. So impressed with this kennel and sorry I purchased the store bought 24”. Feel like this kennel will last for our pup’s life. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So happy I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I adopted an older special needs pup and this is the perfect size! He loves his safe den and will go willingly as his fave blanket (which used to be mine) is in there. I laugh when I see him burying himself underneath the blanket when he doesn’t even have to go into the crate, buut he just wants to. It’s the sweetest! Also, the price for this crate is way cheaper compared to going to a pet store and buying one!
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: and lock easily. I really like that it has 2 doors
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these 5 months ago. It's held up really well to daily use and being collapsed and transported a handful of times. Both doors open, close, and lock easily. I really like that it has 2 doors, so can be conveniently situated it about any room. This is the perfect size for our 10 lb. rat terrier... and in a pinch, we've also put our 8 lb chihuahua in with her, and both dogs were comfortable together. This is a great value for the price! We ended up buying another for our chihuahua (he was too cramped in the xs size we had for him). I would definitely recommend these for small dogs!
customer_reviews.author: litlckrets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome crate!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a crate for my new shelter dog and wanted to know she wouldn't be able to escape when we are gone so I picked this one up cause it seems sturdy, AND WOW! This crate is bulletproof! No way our doggo is getting out of this one! Great quality all around! Super easy setup​ and take down as well! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Greggory Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy; great price!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for my foster kittens. I’ve never had more than 3, but I imagine I could have up to 7-8 in this huge crate. I’ll admit, it would be easier if this had a side door, but I guess I knew that going into my purchase. 🤷‍♀️ It’s very sturdy and the price was way lower than purchasing it in-store locally. It’s definitely heavy, so you may need a partner maneuvering it. It doesn’t slide on carpet very well 😂 Great product; would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Sassy DeVille

customer_reviews.title: No Sharp Wires
customer_reviews.text: Quick review. Almost liked elsewhere due to the negative reviews on sharp wires. Happy to report Midwest must have fixed the problem (if there was one). We had Midwest for 10 years w prior GSD and this crate as well as the last one... Nothing bad to report! We got the Lifestyles grade and it's super heavy gauge wire. I can't even imaging what the Pro grade would be (maybe r-bar built) ! No sharp wires. Fit and finish is excellent! You won't be disappointed! Look nowhere else! And link to Amazon thru GermanShepherdMan.com to help out his channel. He's a good guy!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Not well built at all!
customer_reviews.text: There are several places on the crate where the welds are poor and my dog (puny 16 lb beagle / dachshund) has been able to pull the metal apart. Also, the crate was bent when it arrived, which made the doors tough to operate and may have contributed to the damaged welds. Definitely not for a dog who attempts to escape crates!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: My 38 pound Border Collie absolutely loves her home. ...
customer_reviews.text: My 38 pound Border Collie absolutely loves her home. We crate trained her to this crate and she sleeps in it every night. We have never closed the door, haha cause she just stays in there all night on her own. Whenever there is lightning or thunder, she heads straight home to her private little safe place. We do put a cover on the top and 2 sides to make it more cozy for her. Very strong and well made. We will have it for YEARS I am sure..
customer_reviews.author: DLS

customer_reviews.title: Great for labs and golden retrievers
customer_reviews.text: We've used this crate for labs and golden retrievers and have had no issues. I put a treadmill mat under it to protect our hardwood floors and carpet (we have a couple these crates). Dual doors make it more versatile on where we can put them in our house. We had to replace the plastic tray in our first one after a decade of regular use. We used the divider with our golden retriever puppies, but not with our lab puppies. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Perfect upgrade for our 24lb French Bulldog. We had her in a smaller crate, but once she was crate trained I wanted to get something more spacious & comfortable - this was perfect! Metal is sturdy & as expected without being overly too bulky/heavy. It definitely won't be one that we travel with, but will be staying in our home for her permanent space. Great price in comparison to many pet store options that weren't as sturdy or thick wire & ~$140 - SO glad I gave this once a chance. Definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.author: RBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works like described and seems well built
customer_reviews.text: Turned out to be a great dog crate. Very happy with it and that it has the options of two doors. I like the side door better than the end. Especially while potty training. Very easy to reach cleanups from the side. Fits labs and larger. Comes with a divider for two dog but if doing that too small for labs. Which is okay as long as you are planning to use it for two medium to small dogs. Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: TheHuff109

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Built Large Crate
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to keep and use this crate in one given place this is one well built sturdy crate. Two people can move it, up and assembled, anywhere in your home. However, I was looking for a portable crate to disassemble and take with me when I travel and this one is just too heavy to be portable. Home use - again, excellent. Highly recommended and well built
customer_reviews.author: RangerOne

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble.  It reassured my rescue dog.
customer_reviews.text: We used this when our rescue pooch first came to live with us. He wasn't housebroken so it helped with potty training. Mostly though, the open sides helped him not to be as afraid as when he stayed in a covered plastic crate. He could see us in this open crate and that helped to reassure him. He is so smart that he picked up the potty training quickly and he is so sweet he hardly destroyed anything, so he doesn't need it now.
customer_reviews.author: pen

customer_reviews.title: Great price and bigger then I thought
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100 LB. German Shepherd that is getting old and cant control certain things, so I don't want him wandering around my house all day while I'm at work. This crate fits him and then some. He has room to move if he wants to and not feel cramped. It was easy to set up (fold out) and so far has been very sturdy. I have not tried to break this cage down so I am not sure how easy that is. For the money this worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Really great crate and problem resolution
customer_reviews.text: Without question the crate is great. Having two doors really helps with placement in the corners of the room. We had a "small" issue with the crate when delivered. For some reason I contacted the manufacturer (MidWest) rather than Amazon. They were very, very helpful right off the bat and delivered a new crate to us as no cost. They told us to donate the one we had to the local animal rescue. Really excellent service and we are happy customers!
customer_reviews.author: Dean H. Wooldridge Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easily operated
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little cage. I say was because I carried a litter of five kittens to a girl who managed to find new homes for them on social media. I was going to retrieve the cage the next time I saw her as she worked for my sister. Problem is, she fell ill and was unable to work for a couple of months. Don't know if she will return to work so I may have traded a cage for the great work of finding homes for five kittens. If so, GREAT TRADE!
customer_reviews.author: El sie Nicohls

customer_reviews.title: ... who was always acting out and tiring up stuff like upholstery and rugs when left alone
customer_reviews.text: gift for my grandson for his siberan huskey who was always acting out and tiring up stuff like upholstery and rugs when left alone. Now she loves her kennel and she can be left alone indoors for up to a 1/2 day. fits snuggly in a corner of his bedroom. and the double door did come in handy became of the orientation of the room. sturdy, easy to clean. easy to take down and put back up. He has moved once and it worked very well. They use a folded sheet for a cove on 3 sides and the dog seems very content with her abode. Recommend a buy and a rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. KnitEng

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pom Poms
customer_reviews.text: I have a four month old Pomeranian and this was the perfect size for him. Right now since he is so young and tiny, I have the divider up, so he doesn't have any space to use the bathroom in it, but once he gets older and reaches his full size, this will be the perfect size for him. The crate is durable and feels sturdy. It also comes with handles that you can fasten to the top, so if you need to carry it somewhere you can grab those making it easy to carry. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TanGBo21

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable dog crate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and perfect size for medium sized Corgi/Collie mix. We put a blanket over half it so it's a den-like experience for him when it's bed time or when we're at work. I bought a separate water bowl that attaches to the crate and it fits perfectly, as well as a dog bed that fits it. Haven't had to un-fold it yet, but so far it's a good product for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Cindobeast

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: This item is great! We just adopted an 8 year old Rottweiler that was extremely nervous and high strung. She loves going into her crate and settles down nicely. Perfect size. Very happy with everything!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: The perfect crate
customer_reviews.text: this crate works great for our irish terrier puppy. It's too big for him now so we have it sectioned in half and it's perfect. We drape a blanket over the whole thing when we put him in there to make it more quiet and calm for him and he does great! LOVE the removable/plastic floor with a puppy and his many accidents. other plastic crates are much harder to get into and clean if needed, this one's great!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: In my opinion, very unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: I have been in dogs for over 50 years and owned a pet shop/grooming shop for 8 years. In my opinion, not only is this a piece of junk but it is dangerous as well. The side door does not close properly and could easily injure a foot, there are sharp points inside the crate, the plastic pan slides around and has nothing to keep it from sliding all the way out.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great Product; but Beware of Sharp Clips!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 5 month old cocker spaniel pup. He's still got some growing to do, so it's going to be just roomy enough to be comfy by the time he's all grown-up! :) Only con is that the clips that attach the sides to the top have sharp corners. You'll want to handle with care, but it doesn't pose a problem for my pup, since it's at the top of the crate.
customer_reviews.author: Kacidee

customer_reviews.title: HUGE!! PERFECT!!
customer_reviews.text: couldn't be happy with the size and quality of this product!! best value around hands down!! couldn't have spent my money better! easy installation and HUGE! Bubba LOVES that he has a bigger kennel for his growing body! He went right in and laid down and started chewing on his bone. right at home!! we did lay down at towel to protect the wood floor that seems like it might be easily scratched by the frame til we can get a small rug of some sort. now we just need a new bed and cover to make his new cave complete!
customer_reviews.author: AbbyNormal

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it, so do we
customer_reviews.text: We needed to have a home base for our female German Shepherd who is now about 14 months old. I had a smaller similar "crate" but it seemed too cramped. This one, the largest standard size, seems ideal for our GSD. She has come to view it as her home and goes and lies down in it, on the rather thick dog beds we have installed. We like it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Drewke

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed. Poorly built.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this crate is getting good reviews. It is very poorly built, the pieces are bent and don't fit together well, edges are rough (I cut my finger right off the bat), and there is clearly zero quality control at this company. Instructions are also terrible, making a frustrating experience even worse. I came very close to simply returning it to Amazon as defective given how junky it is.
customer_reviews.author: met1892

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Just received today and so far seems like a high quality crate. For a growing puppy, we love all aspects of this product: dual doors, divider, and removable tray. The size is also perfect. The divider is nice because it doesn’t fully go all the way to the tray, so you can still use a doggy bed if necessary. For comparison, we purchased another name brand crate in a slightly larger size with similar features and paid about $80 for it. 😱 i would definitely recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_customer...

customer_reviews.title: My son is very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son. He has a German Shephard pup and was needing a crate. I purchased this knowing that he would need one that would accommodate his dog as she grew. He loves how easy it was to put together. The tray in the bottom works great to clean up any messes she made. Aketa is now loving her new "house." He has her a blanket in it and she knows that this is where she is to go to sleep. It worked out perfect for the two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ccbilbo

customer_reviews.title: Got a little more than I bargained for
customer_reviews.text: Relatively simple to set up. Unfortunately, I lost my balance near the crate and punctured my foot on one of the wires sticking out. I would encourage this company to round out all of the ends of the wires so that other clumsy folks such as myself (or, Heaven forbid, a puppy) doesn't experience the same fate. Otherwise, my pup seems to be doing well in the crate. I am probably going to have to sand them down or put silicone around the offending wire ends.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: We are using this for our Boston Terrier. It is sturdy and she fits in it comfortably. When assembling it, it was a little difficult (pinched my finger pretty hard) on the last clip. It didn't want to snap together. Only problem with it now is the top latch doesn't close easily. We just use a light blanket to cover the top and sides...She doesn't look to chew anything but her toys.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool and full time sleeping crate!
customer_reviews.text: I potty trained my puppy in this and trained her in it. Very easy to do. She’s 3 now and goes in on her own like it’s her safe space. She prefers to sleep in it and stays completely quiet until I get her out of it. I bought a second one for her when she’s staying at my parent’s farm because she loves it so much! Easy to breakdown and the beds you buy for it fit perfectly. The plastic liner you can take out and wipe down easily. It’s pretty heavy duty, so transporting it around frequently would be a chore, just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Bangarang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, and second hand at that!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a second cage because I have 2 dogs. We sometimes take them overnight to family and they need to be confined at night and when they are left alone in the house for short periods of time. I dreaded buying another expensive cage and broke down and bought a second hand one. The box it came in was all tattered but the cage itself was in perfect condition! I am well pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L. W.

customer_reviews.title: Not just for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it for my 3 cats in the rear of my 2006 Honda Odyssey. I removed the rear seats, but this would fit with the seats folded flat. I have it safely secured with "Cartman Lashing Straps." It is very sturdy and has no sharp edges. 42" fits perfect side to side, and gives them loads of room. I put a couple "Pecute Cat Kitten Hanging Hammocks" suspended from the side and top bars to give them a multilevel effect.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect crate!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of them. One for the family room and one for the bedroom. We have a golden retriever puppy and this crate had done its job. Our pup is now 55lbs and 7 months old and this crate is still doing it's job. The divider came in very handy when he was smaller. He not longer needs the divider. I love this crate and so does my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Edward D. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is just perfect. Very sturdy and well-made. I got it for my puppy and never bothered to add the little compartment to it as she doesn't seem to have a problem with all this "wide open space." I attached a set of water and food dishes --to it and put her blanket and a few toys in there and just leave the door open. She goes in there on her own now. Overall I'd say this is an excellent purchase, especially as I do take periodic trips to visit my parents and just fold this thing up and put it in the trunk with no problems. My baby girl loves it and so do I.
customer_reviews.author: Melodie Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: 😘 Love this crate so do my Brownie he weighs 140 lb very, very good quality Yes i will buy another one if needed don't buy one at Walmart or a Pet stores this one is better than anywhere I went , I return the one I bought back to Walmart with a smile 😁and you can dress them up and make them look like a real dog house😍. Inside your home. P.s this one is alot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: avf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!👌👍
customer_reviews.text: I have a pitbull terrier who's 7 years old. He looks like a puppy in this thing. Lol. So it's definitely huge. He loves it. It's his "bedroom." He can stand up, turn around, sleep stretched all the way out. Assembly is a cinch! Directions are very easy to read. I can open it up in less than a minute and close it down just the same. Very durable. Well made! I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Henry

customer_reviews.title: I think you an your furbaby  will be pleased
customer_reviews.text: Got a baby German Shepard.Always owned Chihuahuas.I.I ordered this from Amazon warehouse for $47.It has a a divider 2 doors an this kennel is umbendable.I feel I got a awesome..deal.Its well worth full price too.. Word of warning!!!Always remove collars an harness after walking an before entering.I read horror stories an I love my baby an I know you do too.Never take a chance with his/her safty or life..I think you will be pleased
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best.
customer_reviews.text: Best crate I have ever used. Folds down easily and is built solid. There has been a review of sharp edges on the bottom of the crate. I have found this to be somewhat true but I don't know how you would get around this with the way it's built. It's also something I don't worry about since my dogs have two layers of padding in their beds. They may be spoiled but who would want to spend time in their "bed" without some padding? I wouldn't want any dog/cat to have to lay on a plastic surface that can be cold and slippery. I would purchase these again and haven't found anything superior to them.
customer_reviews.author: NJS

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value
customer_reviews.text: This crate has heavier gauge metal than others I have purchased over the years. To assemble simply slide out of box. Lift the top section to its upright position, sides and top are firmly hinged to the base. Next reach in and raise the end section to its upright position and set clips at the top, end sections also firmly hinged to base. Repeat this on the other end for final assembly. Time to complete 5-10 minutes. The tray liner is also better than average quality. Two handles included that clip anywhere on the crate to suit your preference. Well pleased and recommend
customer_reviews.author: A CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: Issues with top latch
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these crates to use for our newly adopted puppy. We received our first crate and began setting it up and realized that the top latch wouldn’t slide closed only the bottom latch. We contacted Amazon and they immediately sent us a second crate for replacement. Unfortunately, the second crate also has issues closing the top latch on the front side of the crate. It is better than the first crate we received, but still sticks and you must finagle it just right to slide the latch closed. The bottom latch slides closed with ease. Frustrated that two different crates we received and both have issues closing the top latch on the front door of the crate.
customer_reviews.author: katchoo

customer_reviews.title: Double door idea & I insertable wall is genius!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pet crate. I have a very small bedroom, so I loved that I turn the cage however and still have a door that’s accessible. Very durable and extremely easy to disassemble or assemble. Collapses down to be very small, but is still very heavy. The wall that can be put in is AWESOME. I would HIGHLY recommend if you have a small puppy or are potty training. Excellent buy
customer_reviews.author: Marmallama

customer_reviews.title: Good size crate for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have XL Dogs. For the price this is a good crate. Those of you who are familiar with central metal crates, you will be disappointed. The weight of the bars is not heavy duty. And the method of securing the sides is not ideal. You must push them behind a latch in order to latch them. I use these crates for holding my dogs ringside at dog shows. If I were to use them daily, they may not hold up with day-to-day use. I am satisfied with these crates for the purpose I use them. They are light in weight, secure easily for transport, and are easily to set up.
customer_reviews.author: james s.

customer_reviews.title: Fits my car and my dog!
customer_reviews.text: Great basic crate. Fits in (2008) Subaru Outback. This was a great solution to a safety problem--I couldn't see anything out my back window with the plastic crate in the back seat. Also, my dog likes the view and airflow of this crate a lot more!!! EDITED to add photo of my 47-pound Welsh Springer Spaniel napping in the crate (for size). He’s about the size of an average Border Collie, large-ish beagle, or medium-sized Pit Bull.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading reviews and buy it
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 48” for my full grown male German Shepherd and he has plenty of room! The chart recommends his breed be in the 48” so that’s what i bought but clearly a 42” would have been just fine. It’s very durable as my dog hates kennels and is an escape artist breaking the three previous kennels before. So either he likes the extra room or just can’t bend these bars. Oh and the rollers work great and haven’t scratched our wood flooring like the last kennels! Yay! Very happy i found a reasonably priced kennel my dog can’t break.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Anderson

customer_reviews.title: easy to put together and black coating blends with my ...
customer_reviews.text: This create is made well, easy to put together and black coating blends with my dark furniture. My 50 lb dog fits very comfortable in this crate. She can stand if she wants with no problem. I put her bed in and she’s comfortable to sleep. I’ll leave the door open and both my dogs will go in to sleep:). It’s a life saver for my one dog that gets anxiety during a lightning storm. We’re all in the room together but she has her own nice space. Works for us!
customer_reviews.author: Seven

customer_reviews.title: Well made, affordable, and folds flat for storage.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my Frenchie. It comes with a divider so you can make it smaller for potty training not allowing extra room for them to pee without going on their bedding. You can expand it to full size as they grow. The side door is super convenient and would allow you to orient the crate along a wall and still have access. Or divide it in half for two small dogs each with their own door.
customer_reviews.author: CoastieGurl

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the cage for maybe 2 weeks, I call it a cage as that is what it is. To call these things crates, makes them sound too nice. It is a nice big cage, easy to set up, easy to open and close. I don't have experience with other cages/crates. except the small one my little puppy was shipped in and was not adequate. So far I am happy, I have used the divider and so far no doggy mistakes. Seems to have a lot of room and my dog can look in any direction and see what is going on. I am happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Tony

product_meta.title: Life Stages LS-1642 Single Door Folding Crate for Large Dogs(71 - 90lbs)
product_meta.description: Size:42-Inch w/Divider| Style:Single DoorThe "all inclusive" Life Stages folding metal dog crate by MidWest Homes for Pets includes all of the features you will need to provide a convenient, safe & secure pet home for your best friend. This metal dog crate includes a free divider panel allowing you to adjust the size of the dog crate while your dog is still growing, a plastic leak proof pan for easy clean up in the event of an accident, a strong plastic carrying handle for easy portability & rubber "roller" feet on the bottom of the crate to protect your floors inside the home. MidWest Life Stages also feature our patented side clips which reinforce the dog crate & reduce possible sharp points ensuring a safe experience for you and your pet. Every Life Stages metal dog crate folds down flat for convenient storage. The 42" Life Stages (model 1642U) measures 42L x 28W x 31H inches & is suitable for "Large" dog breeds. **Please note the term “large dog” is subjective. For the best fit, we advise that you check the measurements of the actual dog crate against your dog’s adult weight & measurements. Your dog should be able to comfortably sit upright, lay down & easily turn around inside the dog crate. When in doubt we suggest you purchase the larger crate option. We at MidWest Homes for Pets understand that your dog is a part of your family & that's why we ensure our dog crates are manufactured with the highest quality control standards creating a safe home for your pet that you can feel confident with. MidWest Homes for Pets stands behind the quality of our products with our “MidWest Quality Guarantee” 1 Year Manufacturer's Warranty. If you have any questions about our dog crates our customer service department would be glad to help you. MidWest customer service can be contacted at: 1 800 428 8560, available 9:00 AM 4:00 PM, Monday Friday.
feature_bullets: This single door folding crate measures 42L x 28W x 31H inches & is suitable for large dog breeds
Sets up in seconds with no tools required for assembly and folds flat for convenient storage or travel
Heavy duty slide-bolt latch securely locks dog crate door in place keeping your dog safely inside their pet home

Durable design creates a safe place for your pet while you're away & provides for your dog's instinctual "den" instincts. Patented rounded corner clips greatly reduce possible sharp points in your dog's crate for a safer experience for you & your dog
Dog crate includes a divider panel, durable dog tray, carrying handle, "roller" feet to protect floors & a “MidWest Quality Guarantee” 1-year Manufacturer's Warranty

NOTE: Midwest Pet Products manufactures the iCrate and the Life Stages Dog Crates. The main difference is the Life Stages is made of heavier gauge steel and has a tighter wire mesh making it stronger than iCrate

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars12,521 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Midwest Life Stages Folding Metal Dog Crate, Abs-Plastic Pan
